Articles.Content:
When you set up a maneuver, fields appear to the lower right of the NAV ball showing "Est. Burn"  and "Node in T -". 

Can these be made larger for my old eyes? The rest of the NAV Ball text is legible, but that small font on 1080 screen is hard to see at times, depending on the background. A simple selectable font size would work best. 

Thanks.
Fonts have been improved in 1.2.  I'm not sure if it what you want, but here is a screenshot at 100% scale
You can also tweak the navball to be larger in the settings, this will make the burn indicators larger too.

1 hour ago, Red Iron Crown said:

You can also tweak the navball to be larger in the settings, this will make the burn indicators larger too.

It really needs to be detached from the NavBall in that regard though.  I can see why a person would want to increase the size of that burn time indicator without increasing the size of the entire NavBall.

Though, adding sliders for every line of text is a bit overkill.  In this case there is enough room there, they could just bump up the text size to be equal to the dV text, heading text, or velocity text size and it would still fit in the allocated spot and be much more readable.

The font improvement helps, but I think his suggestion is still valid, that text size needs to be just a bit bigger.

Edited September 14, 2016 by Alshain

+quiet a bit for this, especially on the console - 32" TV here at 1080p on eggbox, the smallest test size is lean forwards to read it.

Would be nice to have the ability to adjust text specifically, say small, medium and large text with a couple of size options for each, or even just to make the smallest text the size of the 'Target', 'Orbit' etc text on the naval

Unifying the text to one common size (for the NAV ball info at least) would be fine as the NAV ball is fine otherwise. I do find myself leaning into the screen to see burn times all the time and I have a 26" widescreen 1080 monitor. 

Thanks.

On 9/14/2016 at 9:57 AM, shadragon said:

Can these be made larger for my old eyes? 

No offense, but also having old eyes... my solution was to get new glasses.  (Specifically, breaking down and finally admitting that I needed bifocals and a pair of reading/computer glasses.)
